title: Building Editor: crash if Visual SceneNode is NULL

content.raw:
This is a bit tricky to reproduce, but if you create a building in the Building Editor, save it and exit and delete the resulting model by pressing the Delete key on the keyboard, the model name in the Scene Tree will remain. If you click on the name and delete that, then open the Building Editor again and try to draw something, Gazebo will crash with:

```
[Err] [Visual.cc:140] Unable to get parent scene node
***** Internal Program Error - assertion (this->dataPtr->sceneNode) failed in void gazebo::rendering::Visual::SetPosition(const gazebo::math::Vector3&):
/home/jackie/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc(1540): Visual SceneNode is NULL```
content.html:
This is a bit tricky to reproduce, but if you create a building in the Building Editor, save it and exit and delete the resulting model by pressing the Delete key on the keyboard, the model name in the Scene Tree will remain. If you click on the name and delete that, then open the Building Editor again and try to draw something, Gazebo will crash with:

[Err] [Visual.cc:140] Unable to get parent scene node ***** Internal Program Error - assertion (this->dataPtr->sceneNode) failed in void gazebo::rendering::Visual::SetPosition(const gazebo::math::Vector3&): /home/jackie/gazebo/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc(1540): Visual SceneNode is NULL
